noun.description: A perennial species of lavender, Lavandula stoechas (family Lamiaceae), native to the Mediterranean, previously cultivated as a medicinal herb but now commonly grown in gardens for its spikes of pink-purple flowers.

origin: Late 16th century; earliest use found in John Gerard (c1545–1612), herbalist. Alteration of sticados, variant of stechados, with omission of the final -s (apparently reinterpreted as the English plural ending).
